comments.commentBody: You mention Benghazi... an issue that had our country divided. That was worthy of a special prosecutor, as was fast and furious, as was Hillary's private server,but the Democrats and Obama stopped all three from ever happening.  I' say let sessions alone. It is a witch hunt. What could they have possibly discussed that would harm our nation and our security? The Clintons did far worse with their pay to play, and if she had ever been elected, all of her foreign donations would be front and center of her presidency and our country would be in total chaos.
Perhaps you haven't noticed, but our country *is* in total chaos.

You don't get it, are you? What if the democrat ask for chinese help the next time? Can Canada get in the game too, say, in exchange for part of Vermont? We would like to have the whole of lake Memphremagog.
Are you trying to be funny or did you really miss all of the taxpayer money spent on these events?

Picture says it all.

Sergey I. Kislyak, the Russian ambassador, is among a small group of diplomats who chat with Jeff Sessions after an event during the Republican National Convention.

4 days later WikiLeaks releases 20,000 DNC emails.

Paul Manafort, Michael Flynn and Jeff Sessions - all Trump election surrogates met privately with the Russians.

The Attorney General Sessions perjured himself under oath and must resign.

Putin has been caught influencing the US Presidential election and elections in other western democracies.

People in the US government who were complicit in working with the Russians must be investigated and brought to justice for treason.

What I find missing in all this discussion is a representation of what is -NORMAL- and -conventional- interaction between the campaign and transition staff and foreign agents and dignitaries. Perhaps it is senescent forgetfulness, but I do not recall any account of the incoming Obama or Bush administrations having such high profile interactions with foreign dignitaries. The contacts between Bush or Obama (or their teams) and foreign heads of state did not, AFAIK, extend beyond conventional congratulatory messages. Meetings or conversations extending into the policy realm did not occur, or at least did not occur to the point of newsworthiness.

That Mr. Trump and his acolytes -APPEAR- to have acted as a shadow government, to the point of telegraphing potential policy (and thereby undermining the sitting President) is to my mind unprecedented. Coupled with the substantive questions of Russia's interference in our electoral process, the situation demands extraordinary action by the Congress - and the GOP will be tarnished by unresolved issues! - or the Department of Justice (a special prosecutor) or both.
Please stop repeating Trump's keywords that he uses to brand people/conversations/everything. You're helping him spread misinformation and doubt in his accusers by doing so.
"She did it first! is the predictable excuse of this insufferable brat with the illusion of superior intellect by virtue of too much money.

The first evidence of collusion is Trump himself, asking the Russians to hack Hillary some more. He believes he is above the law, "I could shoot someone and they would still vote for me." When I heard this, I new we would be investigating him whether he was elected or not.
His actions, if this is true, were clearly traitorous and he could well be prosecuted for this, a much worse scenario than just an impeachment.

for that. He deserves

That made me laugh, but not because you were trying to be funny.

Republicans as a group seem to care more about party interests (and power) than pretty much anything else. Right now they are backing Trump because they've managed to convince themselves (as power mongers tend to), that in fact, their party's interests are the same as national interests.

At the point their power is actually threatened, I predict they will remember what national interests really are; and not a moment before then.

Let's throw Jill Stein's candidacy into the mix of the Russia-gate investigation and her $40,000 payment from Putin to sit at his table.  I imagine a third-party candidate like Stein gained just enough more votes with that and additional Russia backing to be a factor in Trump's "win." Stein's not saying anything about Putin now and she has echoed many of Trump's praises for Putin.  Curiouser and curiouser.
These people do not think the consequences of any of their obsessions through to their inevitable conclusions.

I am reminded of listening to an experienced foreign correspondent, interviewing a foreign dictator, not letting them get away with repeated lying.
Yet even with all the obvious, bald faced lies of the past few months, the mainstream media keep shying away from calling out what is happening. Maybe out of habit, respect for the institution of the presidency?
It seems so obvious from the evidence that many people in this administration, including the president, and the congress, are lying repeatedly. Corruption is blatant. Conflicts of interest are unequivocal. But no one in the mainstream is using the word "lies".
If Jeff Sessions' answer under oath to the question about contacts with Russia was not a lie, what is? When President Trump campaigned for a muslim ban, then claims that it is not, how could that possibly be construed as anything other than lying?
War is Peace
Freedom is Slavery
Ignorance is Strength
I'm pretty sure that deliberately lying in one's confirmation hearing is not in the "protecting the country" job description.

This is all a "Murder She Wrote" episode written by Edgar Allan Poe. The noses have grown so long from lying they now reach Russia. If these shenanigans of duplicity, deception, intrigue & fraud don't put a 9/ll fear into normal individuals then those souls are unconscious. This is way way beyond scarey.

Your alone on that one oldmaid. My state works just fine. And Hitler was pure evil who butchered lots of innocent people and lied and lied and lied to boot.

My country is already great. Or at least it was until Jan 20, 2017 the day the crowd-size whiner and hate monger seized power.

Trump's enormous ego may be the fissure in his broadly boasted business prowess that does him in. I envision when that when approached by an aid or advisor with inquiries like "What if they do find something, what will we do?" Trump would scoff that he's gotten this far with deflection in the face of blatant lies, he can just keep playing the same game plan. His arrogance won't allow him to see how vulnerable he is, and his potent intimidation will cause his team to back down.
Trump is extremely clever and expert on street business tactics. He is full of surprises. But, even he has limits. After all, he did face bankruptcy 6 times.

Now I fully understand why Trump has not released his taxes and why has not divested his business interests.  He has never been under any illusions that he would last.  He will resign sooner or later, and will then declare triumphantly that he was too much of a maverick to be accepted by the "corrupt system," and will spend the rest of his life cultivating his political martyrdom, as well as regaling himself and the few who will continue to adulate him, with tales of his 2016 Presidential win.....
No, no.  He drained the swamp.  And built a cesspool.

Tax Returns.
Tax Returns.
Tax Returns.

D'ya feel me?

I'm talking Tax Returns. It'll be the blueprint of this man's dark and small soul.

When Hillary Clinton was queried about her actions as Secretary of State regarding Benghazi, she volunteered to answer any and all questions for as long as it took, and she did the same thing with the emails and server issue.

In the situation with the Russian interference and hacking in our election, as well as possible collusion with the Trump campaign, there has been a steady stream of denials, then leaks and then when proof comes out there were meetings, then we have Trump's Whitehouse admitting meetings had taken place.

Unlike Hillary Clinton, Donald Trump has done everything a guilty man would do, lie, misrepresent facts and deny, but his antics of tweeting to deflect from this serious and possible impeachable offense.

Trump who has a history of lying and avoiding any responsibility has always found a way to either cover his backside by filing bankruptcy or settling out of court, but it may be the time that Trump has to finally pay the piper.....Big Time!

Donald Trump's oval office is not only smelling like a swamp, it's starting to smell more like a cesspool of corruption.
Keep the pressure on. They, the Grifter and Liar and his Merry Bunch,  cannot get away with treason. Jail them!
We need to see Trump's tax returns.  It Is his ties to the Deutsche Bank and Russian oligarch money lenders that has to be forced out of the liar, liar pants on fire creep in the White House.
Oh yes, he'll publish them after the "audit" is done. Which, the IRS says, you can do even during an audit. Let's put "audit" in quotes again.

Fine. Let's have an independent investigation and see Trumps tax records. If you were Trump and innocent isn't hat what you would want? Oh, and 3 million more Americans liked Clinton'd message more than Trump's.

Yes, but if those committees are controlled by Republi-cants, you can bet that that information will never be shared with the American public.  (That's why President Obama had to disperse the info widely throughout the intelligence agencies, i.e. to protect it from being destroyed.)

There are so many issues that have come to a head just this week, that I feel the need to organize them more or less linearly.

- Ok, so Jeff Sessions recused himself under fire. Big deal. How is that going to give the Justice Dept. the freedom it needs to investigate this matter honestly? How many DOJ staff are under his direct control and answer to him? (The answer is all of them.) The entire Justice Dept. must be recused and Sessions needs to resign. What little credibility he had is gone forever.

- Next observation- the FBI knew about Jeff Sessions' contacts with the Russians BEFORE he was confirmed and didn't think it was necessary to inform the Senate? Even after they knew Sessions lied, under oath, to the Senate, the FBI remained quiet. This is the same FBI that interfered in our country's presidential election to cripple the Democratic candidate with innuendos about what might be on Anthony Wiener's computer. This agency has been corrupted and compromised. The FBI can't be trusted to conduct a thorough and honest investigation either.

- We already know the GOP controlled Congress will be no help unless we need it to obstruct something. (Sorry Dems, there just aren't enough of you. Yet.)

- I am afraid all I have done is laid out this week's crop of worries. We desperately need a "Deep Throat", or several of them, to blow open this Gordian knot so we can clean up and restore our republic.
Thank you!  And you're certainly right about the need for a Deep Throat again.

In the schoolyard, the honest kids would chant "Cheaters never prosper," as they hand over their lunch money to the bullies-  the basket of 44% that managed to rally behind  this  C student  will remain unconvinced that any of the Russian contacts affects their access to guns and gated communities. It is up to the other 56% to show up and be counted on election day.

What to do?

The same standard should hold that was used for Loretta Lynch when she met with Bill Clinton. The same standard that should be used for the Senators who met with the Russian Ambassador.

What a red herring. This isn't an issue of importance, it's a witch hunt of desperate, losing members of a party that still can't figure out why they lost.

And based on this and other actions, they'll continue to lose, as none of this leads to any alternative plan for the US and its citizens to prosper. And in the end, it's the economy, stupid.

Don't you think integrity is important? He was applying for the job of top law enforcement officer in the country and he lied to the senators who were to decide whether to confirm him about a matter of national importance. That is perjury.

Bill Clinton's lie about an affair, while offensive, was not an issue of national security. And for that he was impeached. How about some reasonable balance in our political positions and conversations.

Stupid indeed to have elected a man and party whose economic record for the last 40 years has been abysmal for the working and middle classes by every measure. Simple math is all anyone needs to see that GOP economics is a shell game, still transferring money from the poor to the rich.But as long as Republicans have minorities and immigrants to blame, they don't need no stinking math. It really is the economy, so in fact it is stupid to be diverted into looking at anything but the fallacious numbers being served up by our 6 time bankrupt economist in chief.

@tom; RS; Deborah:

So all these Senators met with the Russian ambassador but forgot? Oh my! I guess integrity doesn't mean anything unless it's the opposing party, right? And Deborah, if you don't understand the relationship between illegal immigration lowering wages and reducing job opportunities for entry-level job seekers, and lower skills citizen candidates, you aren't paying attention or you deliberately ignore the data.

My point is if you want ethics purity, police your own, first. Hillary, the DNC and their collusions with mainstream media were sickening and turned people to vote for someone who wasn't so corrupt. Bernie was an option, but those parties made sure he didn't win the nomination. So now you're complaining about Trump being elected and trying to destroy his legitimacy by any means necessary. What hypocrisy. Democrats have nothing to offer the American people, since they prioritized illegals over citizens and legal immigrants, and identity groups over America the whole.

I'm not saying the Republicans are perfect either. But Trump and his team have a plan. And part of that plan is enforcing immigration law. I know that this drives hard Dems like you crazy but it's actually refreshing that the rest of us see the law being applied equally on this important issue.

Stop the fake outrage after totally planting this story, (well) timed to take the news away from Trump excellent speech to Congress.
